flow.descriptionCdata:
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.182f7035-64e0-4057-a861-cd58df906478.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.3a952e12-44a4-4aed-893f-527e9732286f.callout=Run the shell file on the target machine and take the results. 9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.40a05ae0-357a-49db-9bab-b345af85650b.callout=Copy the shell file from source machine to the target machine using SCP. 9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.45cb76b0-a1bd-471a-9176-9a10c43045b0.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.47bddb2c-3de0-40e0-9986-e224e8c3904e.description=
Copies files between two remote machines through secure SSH

Inputs\:
sourcePath - The absolute path to the source file.
sourceHost - The host of the source file.
sourcePort - The port used for connecting to the source host.
sourceUsername - The username for connecting to the host of the source file.
sourcePassword - The password for connecting to the host of the source file. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
sourcePrivateKeyFile - Absolute path of the private key file for public/private key authentication on the source host.
destinationPath - The absolute path to the destination file.
destinationHost - The host of the destination file.
destinationPort - The port used for connecting to the destination host.
destinationUsername - The username for connecting to the host of the destination file.
destinationPassword - The password for connecting to the host of the destination file
destinationPrivateKeyFile - Absolute path of the private key file for public/private key authentication on the destination host. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.

Responses\:
success - The file was copied successfully.
failure - The file could not be copied.

Result\:
Result of the secure copy action.
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.8d00eac7-bb9d-4bc7-ac3a-681e8768196e.callout=Delete the shell file from the target machine. 9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.9065b56f-b0e3-4987-a8b1-a0c67e693361.description=
This is an operation that does nothing. It can be used for filtering flow variables by feeding them in as inputs and filtering them on the results tab.

Inputs\:
field1 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field2 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field3 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
field4 - optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Responses\:
success - this operation never fails.
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.a24c8351-fa5c-4d08-9a53-c466487b6222.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.adb8e87f-e9c0-4809-ba6c-3200e1a34823.description=
Generates UUID.

Inputs\:
None

Responses\:
success - The operation completed Successfully.

Returns\:
UUID [Universally Unique IDentifier]
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.ae561b70-d7f5-4868-890e-a68a3d34033c.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.b3512549-3be9-4e1e-b817-4d318c6226e6.description=
Runs an SSH command

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address.
port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input -in a syntax like host\:port-, if this exists.
command - The command to execute.
arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
pty - Whether to use pty (true, false. Default is false).
privateKeyFile - Path to private key file, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on the RAS.
username - Username to connect as.
password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete (optional, default 90 seconds).
characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the target machine. For example, SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8.  By default it is UTF-8. 
closeSession - Close SSH session at completion of this operation (true, false)? If false the ssh session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. If true the ssh session used by this operation will be closed. Default is true.

Responses\:
success - The command was executed successfully.
failure - The command could not be executed.

Extra Results\:
STDERR - The STDERR of the command.
STDOUT - The STDOUT of the command.
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.cef28a8e-2fd2-4688-b245-66f801f4f8bf.description=
Runs an SSH command

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address.
port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input -in a syntax like host\:port-, if this exists.
command - The command to execute.
arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
pty - Whether to use pty (true, false. Default is false).
privateKeyFile - Path to private key file, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on the RAS.
username - Username to connect as.
password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete (optional, default 90 seconds).
characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the target machine. For example, SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8.  By default it is UTF-8. 
closeSession - Close SSH session at completion of this operation (true, false)? If false the ssh session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. If true the ssh session used by this operation will be closed. Default is true.

Responses\:
success - The command was executed successfully.
failure - The command could not be executed.

Extra Results\:
STDERR - The STDERR of the command.
STDOUT - The STDOUT of the command.
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.d58560d9-1d7a-4248-8e84-afe3dc2abab4.callout=Linux - Run Shell File using SSH protocol 9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.d7f94a1d-fdc6-4bd9-820f-f02d67cdc34d.callout=Initialise executeScript and deleteScript variables. 9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.description=
Execute a shell file (*.sh) on a Linux machine using the SSH protocol. If the target machine is different than source machine then the shell file is copied on a temporary file on the target machine in the folder given by the input targetWorkingDirectory. There the temporary file is executed and in the end deleted.

Inputs\:
    sourceHost - Hostname or ip address of the source machine, where the script file is.
Default value\: 127.0.0.1
    sourceUsername - Username of the source machine.
    sourcePassword - Password for the sourceUsername.
    sourceScriptPath - The path to the shell file on the source machine.
Examples\: /root/myScript.sh
    targetHost - Hostname or ip address of the target machine, where the script file will run.
Default value\: sourceHost
    targetUsername - Username of the target machine.
Default value\: sourceUsername
    targetPassword - Password for the targetUsername.
Default value\: sourcePassword

Responses\:
    success - The script was successfully launched and has completed executing on the target machine.
    failure - There were problems in the execution of the script.

Results\:
    returnResult - The result of the remote command.
    StdOut - Standard output from the remote process.
    StdErr - Standard error from the remote process.

Notes\:
1. Both source and target must be Linux machines.

Optional inputs\:
    sourcePort - The port number for running the command on source machine.
Default value\: 22
    targetPort - The port number for running the command on target machine.
Default value\: 22
    targetWorkingDirectory - A temporary folder where the script will be executed.
Default value\: /tmp
Examples\: /tmp, /home, /var/tmp
    timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete.
Default value\: 90000
    characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the target machine.
Default value\: UTF-8
Examples\: SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8
9cee1a96-7423-486c-b304-1c453f700164.e77aa69b-2428-4150-813b-daf3916d9da6.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
flow.name: Run Shell File on Linux

scriptlet.name: Step Script file is local in Flow Run Shell File on Linux (0f75d845-7c08-4823-98d3-8dc094f7256d)
Step Set Default Values in Flow Run Shell File on Linux (07a7f6f9-7353-4873-bbd1-fe102245b495)
